title: Nigerian parents left in suspense weeks after kidnappers abduct 300
snippet: Parents in rural Nigeria still have no idea what has happened to their children weeks after kidnappers abducted 300.

title: Mother recounts escape from landslide amid Indonesia floods
snippet: Indonesian mother Sri Yuni Pardede fled with her baby as landslides struck her community in North Tapanuli.

title: Has the Pentagon really exonerated Pete Hegseth over Signal leaks?
snippet: US defense secretary was accused of putting military personnel in danger when he used messaging app to discuss strikes.

title: Children in Sri Lanka floods have nowhere “to go back to”
snippet: “They don't have anywhere to go back to."

title: Ilhan Omar condemns ‘creepy’ Donald Trump’s attack on Somali communities
snippet: Donald Trump has doubled down on his attacks on Somali-Americans, saying Somali immigrants have “destroyed our country”.

title: What we know about the DC shooting suspect’s shadowy Afghan CIA unit?
snippet: The Afghan refugee who shot two US national guardsmen in Washington DC is a veteran of the CIA’s shadowy Zero Units.

title: Israel says Palestinian groups returned body of Thai hostage held in Gaza
snippet: The remains of agricultural worker Suthisak Rintalak were recovered by Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad in northern Gaza.

title: Rain forecasts raise fears in flood-hit Indonesia, Sri Lanka
snippet: The Indonesian weather agency warned that some provinces in Sumatra would see moderate to heavy rain.

title: Five killed in Israeli air strikes on tents near Khan Younis, medics say
snippet: Rescue workers say they recovered bodies from a camp for displaced people. The IDF says it "struck a Hamas terrorist".

title: Marquis data breach impacts over 74 US banks, credit unions

title: Microsoft "mitigates" Windows LNK flaw exploited as zero-day
snippet: Microsoft has silently "mitigated" a high-severity Windows LNK vulnerability exploited by multiple state-backed and cybercrime hacking groups in zero-day attacks. [...]

title: Aisuru botnet behind new record-breaking 29.7 Tbps DDoS attack
snippet: In just three months, the massive Aisuru botnet launched more than 1,300 distributed denial-of-service attacks, one of them setting a new record with a peak at 29.7 terabits per second. [...]

title: University of Phoenix discloses data breach after Oracle hack
